intro: Struthanthus deppeanus, commonly known as the desert four o'clock, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in the late afternoon. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are small, narrow, and often covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. Struthanthus deppeanus is known for its unique blooming time, which aligns with the cooler temperatures of early evening.
